content: Loans Credit Card Asked by AnonymousAsked on 26 Mar 2019Just paid for a credit report and noticed that there is one particular bank which has been sending review inquiries 7 times in 2018 alone!? how does that affect my credit score and is it even legal?I did not apply for new credit cards nor ask for any credit review. In fact when they called I told them I'm not interested. Without my permission can they keep sending the enquired and how does that affect my score?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 26 Mar 2019You might have to call that particular bank and ask why they keep looking at your credit report when you did nothing. It will affect your credit score when theres too much enquiries but usually its temporary.0 comments0
